author: diehardlegofan
title: I like it
review:
A lot of people think this set stinks; personally, I don't see what's so bad about it.  It is a really cool set.  It reminds me of the old BIONICLE sets.

Pros:
Good playability
Entertaining build
Fun to play with other Hero Factory sets
The design is very good

Cons:
no cons

This set is awesome, I highly recommend it.

author: DarkLordMakuta
title: Nothing terribly exciting.
review:
Overall a decent set, but not much here the average BIONICLE fan hasn't seen before.

Pros

  • Pistons on the front of legs, which is pretty clever.
  • Some cool new/ recoloured parts, such as the spines.
  • Interesting weapon.

Cons

  • Floppy neck (an easy fix).
  • Short arms.
  • Small feet.

author: jimmybrick
title: Awsome!
review:
This set is probably the best villain you can get in hero factory. he is also the biggest.
 
Pros:
new pieces
cool black hole staff
HUGE!
bulky
cool colour scheme

Cons:
Bionicle helmet recolour


This is a great set and will go well with any large Bionicle.

author: BobaFett2
title: Hey, He's Cool-but before you talk, remember Takanuva? Go back further-Maxilos? Brutaka? Muaka and Kanera?
review:
This is a decent set, which is better than most Hero Factory, which is BIONICLE's replacement.

Building

Well, it's got a decent build but there's some issues. Nothing big, just not that interesting.

Playability

Problems here. The arms move wierdly and unless you attach them just right they won't move at all. The legs are good, but there's two parts sticking out that make the legs unable to go together. The legs have good articulation, but there's still more. The staff's blades will spin but the staff shakes, both reducing the spin and making it seem flimsy. For a weapon it is undersized, the Tridax Pod could do better being partially transparent, and it's too flimsy.

Value for Money

Dunno, it's 20 bucks. Better than Hero Factory, so if you're a TECHNIC Action Figure theme fan then buy it. If you want some of the nostalgia (though I doubt you'll get any from this theme) of BIONICLE, then it might be worth it. Parts, maybe. Otherwise, I wouldn't really recommend him.

Overall

Pros

  • Large Titan, better than any other HF guy
  • A bunch of new parts, nice Black-Blue parts
  • Good leg articulation

Cons

  • Arms are really annoying
  • Arms look weaker
    Hands are odd
  • Staff shakes when spun
  • The colors of the staff's orb look good for a while but get old quickly
    Not as good as Brutaka, Kardas, Muaka and Kanera, Maxilos, Takanuva (huge) and other titans. I'd rate it like Krekka, which is a decent set but it's just got some issues...
Overall, do what YOU want. Buy it if you want it, don't if you do not. Just remember that BIONICLE sets were better than this...

author: V0LD3M0RT
title: Da price is Right!
review:
When I got this for Â£15 I was pretty amazed because it came in a huge box so it was a good surprise. Usually (in bionicles case) sets this large are quite a bit more...anyway.

  • Playability: All good except mine's legs where abit stiff and wouldnt bend at the knee
  • Pros: Nice sculpt,weopons and all. Its all so pretty big another good feature.
  • Cons: Not the best articulation

author: KodakKid365
title: Great set!
review: Von Nebula is a great set! You should get him before anything else.He can step on the heros (because they are tiny.) and even be able to pwn the bad guys. Very good price. I thought he would be at least 30 dollars. He is the biggest set (not counting vehicles) and has an awesome weapon. You can just suck everyone you are fighting up. Probably, the only con is the legs. In the picture on the box his legs are bent. They don't bend. remember that. But don't get me wrong,it's an awesome set.

author: NickBrick
title: Wow...
review:
Sorry its taken like forever to write this. Von Nebula...The mastermind...Von Ness. I really am kind of sad that I didn't pay much attention to Hero factory after I bought two of the sets. But when 2.0 came out, I became obsessed with HF.  I wanted a titan, but I didn't like Fire Lord very much. So I bought an older titan. And I'm glad I did. Von Nebula is...amazing!
POSEABILITY: The arms aren't double jointed. Which is a little disappointing. But surprisingly enough, you can still get Von Nebula into some very awesome poses
PLAYABILITY: Terrific! if you have a hero, make em fight!
WEAPON AND HELMET: The weapon is not very interesting. Its a pole with a recolored tridax pod with some solek blades. The helmet( or mask) is black version of Hydraxon's. And since Hydraxon has one of my favorite masks, I love it!
PARTS: Von Nebula has some very good parts. He has black and blue versions of Xplode's spikes. As well as two black claws. Awesome!
OVERALL: Von Nebula is awesome. And is even better than Rotor. Get him if you can.

author: Mandalorian
title: Just plain awesome
review:
Here he is, Von Nebula, the coolest Hero Factory villain so far. I was surprised to find so many great pieces in the box for such a good price. Then came the building. It is a great, slightly complex build, and the figure itself is amazing. Amazing. First of all, there's the super cool Hydraxon mask in black. Then there's the awesome shoulder spikes, the claws, one of which is holding the black hole staff. Another cool thing is that his other hand is free, which doesn't happen a lot these days. Although the best thing is that his body is wonderfully built, and you do actually "build" this set, as opposed to many other ones.
Pros:
  • Lots of cool pieces
  • A proper, rather challenging build
  • Surprisingly low price
  • Hydraxon mask in black
  • Shoulder spikes
  • Claws, one of which is free
  • Cool spinning black hole staff
Cons:
  • None, absolutely none.

This is one set you simply must have. It doesn't matter how you get it, but you absolutely have to get it.


  •

author: herolegoman
title: JUST EXCELLENT
review:
Von nebula the boss of the baddie's. Bad but not a bad figure. I got this at £15 which is a good price because once you make him he is huge. The parts on him are new such as the mask and the feet.

PRO

  • HUGE
  • black hole staff
  • cool
  • hard to make so a good challenge
  • doesn't break

CON

  • hard to stand up


CONCLUSION
This should be your first hero factory figure because he is just so fun and he is easy to play with so buy buy.

author: Colonel14
title: The Evil and Amazing Von Nebula
review:
I got Von Nebula for Christmas recently, and I must say, he's one of my all-time favorites. Since my old Bionicle Maxilos is spare parts, Nebula now towers over my other Bionicle/Hero Factory models.

 

The Build

 

The build is like that of the old big Bionicle sets (such as Maxilos). The best feature about Bionicle/Hero Factory sets is becuase they are very sturdy, haivng little to no problems standing up. The arms are simple, lacking the detail the legs have.

 

Parts

 

There are a few parts worth mentioning. There's the shoulder pices that are like X-Plodes, except Von's is black with blue tips. A blue and black orb made of two pieces is from what I've seen, unique to this set. There are two pincers used for the face mask, and the peces covering the back are uncommon. The chest piece for Nebula is interesting: it is an old Bionicle foot.

 

Playability

 

Plenty of playability. Soon after my completion of Nebula, I had a tendancy of carrying him around everywhere I go. He's already been on one road trip. Anyways, being easily poseable and with plenty of bendable parts, Nebula has great playability. He also has a villanous presence: probably from the red eyes and the pincers.

 

Recommendation

 

I recommend this set. Twenty bucks for this guy? Deal.

 

Pros and Cons

 

Every set has 'em.

 

Pros.

- Nice 'n sturdy

- Great playablity

- Good build

- Nice parts selection

- Cheap price for a big model

- One of the better Hero Factory models

Cons.

- Pieces covering the back and the head are a little wobbly

- The staff looks like it's just attached to the hand

- Arms lack detail

 

Overall

 

Not the best, but almost. Nebula can almost grasp it. Final verdict: 4/5 stars. Get it whenever possible.

author: TSK15
title: Awesome Epic Von Nebula!!!!!
review:
Box/Instructions  Box Is over all good usual square  of course shows von nebula on the front. Decent size box,the instructions are easy to follow. 

Parts Alot of Nice pieces, some of the pieces are not like later hero factory, They are breakable. If you take them off to many times they will snap. The ball on his staff is my favorite part of him. His armor piece right above his head is the bohrok mask in black. 

The build I am not a fan of builds. I just want to play with whatever I am building. But this build is unique, it is an awesome build so much that could make a unexperienced builder a good builder.

The completed model The complete model is good spinning staff great legs.

Overall opinion Over all opinion great.

author: dubiousfreesamples
title: Something of a mixed bag, but overall very imposing
review: Hero Factory tends to get a really bad rap, and I can certainly see why. The hero sets were subpar, the villain sets felt patchy in terms of quality, and of course, it had the success of Bionicle to live up to. Despite all this, I found all the villain sets to be good in their own way, and Von Nebula is no exception. The build is nowhere near perfect. The position of supports for his legs and arms kind of overlap, reducing posability for both. His thigh-guards move around, sometimes getting in the way of his knees moving. There are massive gaps in his chest, arms and back, there are exposed pins and axles everywhere, and he doesn't even have elbows. However, the build is quite interesting and I can't help but like the finished product, despite it's apparent flaws. The colour scheme is quite uniform for the most part, and the solid black around the wider frame is quite imposing compared to your average constraction figure, despite his relatively short stature. The figure definitely has a certain look to it, and it's immediately recognisable as a villain. In my opinion, he's a worthwhile addition to any collection, but keep in mind the amount of flaws the figure has if you do consider picking him up. It limits his play potential for sure, and may mean that it's a bit of an eyesore at a close level, but he looks great on a shelf.
